definitions.definition: ( transitive ) To fit out with a harness or other equipment .

subdefinitions.definition: ( transitive , nautical ) To equip and fit (a ship ) with sails , shrouds , and yards .
( transitive , manufacturing ) To move (a heavy object) with the help of slings , hoists , block and tackle , levers , or similar equipment.
examples: To rig such massive equipment requires experienced riggers

definitions.definition: ( transitive , informal ) To dress or clothe in some costume .
( transitive ) To make or construct something in haste or in a makeshift manner.
( transitive ) To manipulate something dishonestly for personal gain or discriminatory purposes.
( transitive , obsolete ) To make free with; hence, to steal; to pilfer.
( transitive , intransitive , animation ) To outfit a model with controls for animation.

main_definition: ( transitive ) To fit out with a harness or other equipment .
secondary_definitions: ( transitive , informal ) To dress or clothe in some costume .
( transitive ) To make or construct something in haste or in a makeshift manner.
( transitive ) To manipulate something dishonestly for personal gain or discriminatory purposes.
( transitive , obsolete ) To make free with; hence, to steal; to pilfer.
( transitive , intransitive , animation ) To outfit a model with controls for animation.

definitions.definition: To play the wanton; to act in an unbecoming manner; to play tricks.

main_definition: ( intransitive , obsolete ) To play the wanton; to act in an unbecoming manner; to play tricks.
